smells.name: LargeClass
smells.description: One class should have one responsibility. Large classes tend to handle many things at once. Split up large classes into smaller classes that are easier to understand.

instances.message: Class HomeActivity is too large. Consider splitting it into smaller pieces.

smells.name: NestedBlockDepth
smells.description: Excessive nesting leads to hidden complexity. Prefer extracting code to make it easier to understand.

instances.message: Function doCallTo is nested too deeply.

smells.name: TooManyFunctions
smells.description: Too many functions inside a/an file/class/object/interface always indicate a violation of the single responsibility principle. Maybe the file/class/object/interface wants to manage to many things at once. Extract functionality which clearly belongs together.

Interface 'SelfossService' with '15' functions detected. Defined threshold inside interfaces is set to '11'

smells.name: LongMethod
smells.description: One method should have one responsibility. Long methods tend to handle many things at once. Prefer smaller methods to make them easier to understand.

smells.name: LongParameterList
smells.description: The more parameters a method has the more complex it is. Long parameter lists are often used to control complex algorithms and violate the Single Responsibility Principle. Prefer methods with short parameter lists.

smells.name: UnnecessaryParentheses
smells.description: Unnecessary parentheses don't add any value to the code and should be removed.

instances.message: Parentheses in (response.body() as ArrayList<Item>) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: response.body() as ArrayList<Item>
Parentheses in (apiItems.map { it.toEntity() }) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: apiItems.map { it.toEntity() }
Parentheses in (context != null && context!!.isNetworkAccessible(null)) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: context != null && context!!.isNetworkAccessible(null)
Parentheses in (context != null && context!!.isNetworkAccessible(null)) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: context != null && context!!.isNetworkAccessible(null)
Parentheses in (it.value - 1) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: it.value - 1
Parentheses in (it.key to (it.value - 1)) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: it.key to (it.value - 1)
Parentheses in (it.key to it.value) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: it.key to it.value
Parentheses in (apiItems.map { it.toEntity() }) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: apiItems.map { it.toEntity() }
Parentheses in (1 - p1) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: 1 - p1
Parentheses in (it.tag.longHash() to it.unread) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: it.tag.longHash() to it.unread
Parentheses in (it.tag.longHash() to it.unread) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: it.tag.longHash() to it.unread
Parentheses in (maybeDrawerData != null && maybeDrawerData != apiDrawerData) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: maybeDrawerData != null && maybeDrawerData != apiDrawerData
Parentheses in (maybeDrawerData != null && maybeDrawerData != apiDrawerData) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: maybeDrawerData != null && maybeDrawerData != apiDrawerData
Parentheses in (items.size - 1) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: items.size - 1
Parentheses in (offset + itemsNumber) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: offset + itemsNumber
Parentheses in (response.body()?.toSet() != items.toSet()) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: response.body()?.toSet() != items.toSet()
Parentheses in (if (unread) 1 else 0) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: if (unread) 1 else 0
Parentheses in (if (starred) 1 else 0) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: if (starred) 1 else 0

smells.name: MagicNumber
smells.description: Report magic numbers. Magic number is a numeric literal that is not defined as a constant and hence it's unclear what the purpose of this number is. It's better to declare such numbers as constants and give them a proper name. By default, -1, 0, 1, and 2 are not considered to be magic numbers.

smells.name: SpacingBetweenPackageAndImports
smells.description: Violation of the package declaration style.

instances.message: There should be exactly one empty line in between the list of imports and the declaration of MyApp.
There should be exactly one empty line in between the list of imports and the declaration of ItemsDao.
There should be exactly one empty line in between the list of imports and the declaration of AddSourceActivity.

smells.name: PreferToOverPairSyntax
smells.description: Pair was created using the Pair constructor, using the to syntax is preferred.

instances.message: Pair is created by using the pair constructor. This can replaced by `ContextCompat.getColor(context!!, R.color.dark_webview_text) to ContextCompat.getColor(context!!, R.color.light_webview_text)`
Pair is created by using the pair constructor. This can replaced by `null to null`
Pair is created by using the pair constructor. This can replaced by `ContextCompat.getColor(context!!, R.color.light_webview_text) to ContextCompat.getColor(context!!, R.color.dark_webview_text)`
Pair is created by using the pair constructor. This can replaced by `null to null`

smells.name: ReturnCount
smells.description: Restrict the number of return statements in methods.

instances.message: Function onOptionsItemSelected has 5 return statements which exceeds the limit of 2.
Function onOptionsItemSelected has 3 return statements which exceeds the limit of 2.

smells.name: WildcardImport
smells.description: Wildcard imports should be replaced with imports using fully qualified class names. Wildcard imports can lead to naming conflicts. A library update can introduce naming clashes with your classes which results in compilation errors.

instances.message: androidx.recyclerview.widget.* is a wildcard import. Replace it with fully qualified imports.
apps.amine.bou.readerforselfoss.api.selfoss.* is a wildcard import. Replace it with fully qualified imports.
okhttp3.* is a wildcard import. Replace it with fully qualified imports.

smells.name: DataClassContainsFunctions
smells.description: Data classes should mainly be used to store data and should not have any extra functions. (Compiler will automatically generate equals, toString and hashCode functions)
